title: By god, Riot actually listened
body:
I saw a post saying Katarina had 2 higher base MR than most mid lane assassins or something:

Katarina
Base MR lowered from 34.1 to 32.1 

On the PBE

replies.body:
why is this even remotely surprising to you? Are you new or something? 

Riot always listens, they might not give a shit but they always listen. If you wonder why they don't respond its probably because there are literally like 30 websites recording everything they say in response to whatever lol
But still, im just surprised they listened to the guy and just nerfed her 2 MR.

It was a really clear cut (just straight unintended) and easy to fix (a few minutes) change. A lot of suggestions/arguments we get need a lot of debate, or just aren't actionable in the first place. Some stuff like this though we can act on really quickly.

In terms of Kat's balance I wouldn't expect this to have a significant impact, so it'd be in addition to possible balance work.

A bit off topic, but do you really need a debate about malzahar's rework.? 

Or do you guys realize what an atrocity has been created, and are you planning on changing anything about it, aka VGU or the kog maw treatment, because since the MYMU you guys have showed little consideration for what malz players actually wanted.

I aint gonna hold my breath tho, just look at morde, Im guessing malz will end up like him :/
Problem is Old malz wasn't much better than new one neither.

He required good positioning to be successful,  more skill that he requires now. His jungling was viable and fun.
And at least he wasn't a fucking support.
I used old Malz as a support....
as did I, but he wasnt viable, new malz is bs as a support.
Current malz still needs positioning to be good. Honestly any champion that doesn't have multiple Get out of jail cards or isn't just tanky as hell needs good positioning.
ofcource, but one of the problems with malzahar support is that the sheild blocks enough to get a kill on bot, the passive needs to go one way or another.

>And at least he wasn't a fucking support.

It's okay for him to be a jungler but not a support? I'm smelling a double standard here regarding non-standard roles.

:/

That's not very nice. It's like you consider the support role to be worth less than the others somehow...
The issue with malz support being viable, is that he removes mele supports from the game. He is too opressive to be a balanced support.

Oh, fair enough. Guess I kneejerked there, huh.

I take it that it doesn't apply to the jungling role, since the average jungler has better dueling/mobility options than the average melee support?
His ult. Just eww.
He certainly was not worse, so give the malzahar mains their champion back and perhaps they can consider other changes in the future.
Well if we as a community need to debate about it so do they :)

My first riot response on one of my threads that wasnt "Report a Bug" or  "Help and Support" and its Meddler himself :D

just would like to know.

what alternatives are you giving melee champions to deal with enemy traps next patch, when youre removing the only counterplay to these abilities that still exist?

unless you expect us to stand still for a couple of seconds and auto attack shrooms in lane while teemo is pelting us with a barrage of auto attacks and blinds from range?

the champion is already in a decently strong state as a top laner. please tell me youre not just adding this buff without significant compensation nerfs to his early game.

if you add this change, teemo is literally going to sit in a safety net of shrooms for 15 minutes behind him with no option for his opponents to make a play on him. hell at least be able to kite out every engagement. at worst just straight up kill his opponent if hed be stupid enough to follow.

which basically gives him free reign over the lane.
No bad...

> [{quoted}](name=greenninja10,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vKTbo0PE,comment-id=00000000000100010000,timestamp=2017-02-08T21:03:10.486+0000)
>
> No bad...

he hasnt been a trollpick for quite a long time.

his winrate and playrate have been increasing, and hes actually a strong solo que champion already. even **despite** the ability to disable his traps while fighting him.

hes at an above average playrate for a top laner right now and sitting at 53% winrate.

remember when darius shot up 4% in winrate just because they bugfixed his pull to allow him to pull people mid dash? this is a much larger buff comparably.

this isnt a joke. a buff like that without compensation nerfs will actually make teemo overpowered for the first time in years. not to mention complete cancer to deal with. well, more than he already is.

I play teemo mid lane & have a 75% win ratio on him so I know he's strong. But in the wrong hands he can still be weak. People think he's so easy to play but with how squishy he is (if your not playing tankmo that is) 1 step out of place can loose a trade because of enemy champs getting the first shot. & his early game is hard because his farming techniques are ither set a mushroom or hope your minions don't do too much damage too quick
Do you guys think that Talon will be truly balanced with just number tweaks to his current kit? Genuinely asking.
Is this nerf supposed to combat the magic penetration she often takes in glyphs so it actually feels like early game she has to make a choice between magic pen blues and mr blues?

So I'm not gonna show my bias like Salty Mage did (i do wonder when he picked up that name though).
However, I am curious. If an equal argument, or within margin of error, could be made either direction for something like the malzahar debate (or any decision), then would you guys consider polling data (in client), similar to how you guys did the post MYMU polls, in order to decide a course of action?

I get that you guys over at riot have to make hard decisions on how to move forward with the game, but in some circumstances would it not be valid to make a decision on the preferences of the community, given equally unknown or equally challenging paths?
